ul.li1: “to make a plan, butOr “and” not from me,
ul.li2: and pour out a libation, butOr “and” not from my Spirit,
so as to addLiterally “for the sake of adding” sin to sin.
ul.li1: 2Who go to go down to Egypt,
ul.li2: butOr “and” they do not ask of my mouth,
ul.li1: to take refuge in the protection of Pharaoh
ul.li2: and to take refuge in the shadow of Egypt.
ul.li1: 3And the protection of Pharaoh shall be shame to you,
ul.li2: and the refuge in the shadow of Egypt, humiliation.
ul.li1: 4For his officials are at Zoan,
ul.li2: and his envoys reach to Hanes.

chapter.p: 5Everyone will start to stink because of a people that cannot profit them,

ul.li1: not for help and not for profiting,
ul.li2: but for shame and also for disgrace.”

chapter.p: 6An oracle of the animals of the Negev:

ul.li1: Through a land of trouble and distress,
ul.li2: of lioness and lion,
amongLiterally “from” them are snake and flying serpent;
ul.li1: they carry their wealth on the backsLiterally “shoulder” of male donkeys
ul.li2: and their treasures on the humpsHebrew “hump” of camels,
to a people that cannot profit them.
ul.li1: 7ForOr “And” EgyptiansLiterally “Egypt” help with vanity and emptiness,
ul.li2: therefore I have called this one “Rahab, they are sitting.”
ul.li1: 8Now go, write it on a tablet with them,
ul.li2: and inscribe it on a scroll,
ul.li1: thatOr “and” it may be for the time to come,Literally “for last day”
ul.li2: forever, forever.
ul.li1: 9For it is a people of rebellion, deceitful children,
ul.li2: children who are not willing to hear the instruction of Yahweh,
ul.li1: 10who say to those who do see, “You must not see!”
ul.li2: and to the seers, “You must not see truth for us;
ul.li1: speak smooth things to us,
ul.li2: see illusions,
ul.li1: 11turn aside from the way, turn aside from the path,
ul.li2: put an end to the holy one of Israel from our face.”

chapter.p: 12Therefore the holy one of Israel says this:

ul.li1: “Because you are rejecting this word
ul.li2: and you trust in oppression and cunningLiterally “going wrong”
and you rely on it,
ul.li1: 13therefore this iniquity shall come for you like a breach about to fall,
ul.li2: bulging out on a high wall that breaksLiterally “whose breaking comes” suddenly, in an instant.
ul.li1: 14And he breaks it like a vessel of a potterLiterally “someone who forms” breaks,
ul.li2: that is crushed; he has no compassion,
ul.li1: and no potsherd is found among its fragmentsHebrew “fragment” to take fireLiterally “for the taking away of fire” from the hearth,
ul.li2: or to skimLiterally “for the skimming off of” water from the cistern.”

chapter.p: 15For the Lord Yahweh, the holy one of Israel, said this:

ul.li1: “In returning and rest you shall be saved;
ul.li2: your strength shall be in quietness and in trust.”

chapter.p: ButOr “And” you were not willing, 16and you said,

ul.li1: “No! For we will flee on horses!”Hebrew “horse” Therefore you shall flee!
ul.li2: And, “We will ride on swift horses!”Hebrew “horse” Therefore your pursuers shall be swift!
ul.li1: 17One thousand because ofLiterally “from the face of” a threat of one,
ul.li2: becauseLiterally “from the face” of a threat of five you shall flee,
ul.li1: until you are left like a flagstaff on topLiterally “head” of a mountain,
ul.li2: and like a signal on a hill.

ul.li1: 18Therefore Yahweh waits to be gracious to you,
ul.li2: and therefore he will rise up to show you mercy,
ul.li1: for Yahweh is a God of justice;
ul.li2: blessed are all those who wait for him.
ul.li1: 19For people will live in Zion;
ul.li2: in Jerusalem, you will surely not weep.
ul.li1: Surely he will be gracious to you;
ul.li2: when he hears the sound of your cry, he will answer you.
ul.li1: 20And the Lord will give you the bread of distress
ul.li2: and the water of oppression,
ul.li1: butOr “and” your teachers will not hide themselvesHebrew “himself” any longer.
ul.li2: And your eyes shall seeLiterally “be seeing” your teachers.
ul.li1: 21And your ears shall hear a word from behind you, saying,
ul.li2: “this is the way; walk in it,”
ul.li1: when you go to your right
ul.li2: and when you go to your left.
ul.li1: 22And you will defile the plating of your silver idols
ul.li2: and the covering of your gold image.
ul.li1: You will scatter them like contaminated things;Hebrew “contaminated thing”
ul.li2: you will say to it, “Filth!”Or “Get out!”
ul.li1: 23And he will give rain for your seed with which you sow the ground,
ul.li2: and grain, the produce of the ground, and it will be rich and fertile.Literally “fat”
ul.li1: On that day, your cattle will graze in broad pastures;Hebrew “pasture”
ul.li2: 24and the oxen and the donkeys that tillOr “tilling” the ground will eat fodder, sorrel
ul.li3: that has been winnowed with shovel and pitchfork.
ul.li1: 25And there will be streams on every high mountain and elevated hill,
ul.li2: watercourses of water, on a day of great slaughter, when towers fall.
ul.li1: 26And the light of the full moon will be like the light of the sun,
ul.li2: and the light of the sun will be sevenfold, like the light of seven days,
ul.li1: on the day when Yahweh binds up the breakage of his people,
ul.li2: and he heals the wound of his blow.

ul.li1: 27Look! The name of Yahweh comes from afar,
ul.li2: burning with his anger and heaviness of cloud.
ul.li1: His lips are full of indignation,
ul.li2: and his tongue is like a devouring fire.
ul.li1: 28And his breath is like an overflowing river;
ul.li2: it reaches up to the neck
ul.li1: to shake the nations with the sieve of worthlessness;
ul.li2: and a bridle that leads astray is on the jawbones of the peoples.
ul.li1: 29You shall have a songLiterally “There shall be a song for you” as in the night when a holy festival is kept,
ul.li2: and a gladness of heart like one who goes with the flute,
ul.li3: to go to the mountain of Yahweh, to the rock of Israel.
ul.li1: 30And Yahweh will cause the majesty of his voice to be heard,
ul.li2: and he will cause the descent of his arm to be seen,
ul.li1: in furious anger and a flame of devouring fire,
ul.li2: with a cloudburst and a rainstorm and stonesHebrew “stone” of hail.
ul.li1: 31Indeed, Assyria will be shattered by the voice of Yahweh;
ul.li2: he strikes with the rod.
ul.li1: 32And every stroke of the staff of foundationSome translations emend this to “discipline” that Yahweh lays will be on it with timbrels and lyres,
ul.li2: and he will fight against itThe reading tradition (Qere) has “them” with battles of brandishing.
ul.li1: 33For Topheth has been prepared from yesterday;
ul.li2: indeed, it is made ready for the king.
ul.li1: He makes its pile of wood deep and wide;
ul.li2: he makes fire and wood abundant.Literally “numerous”
ul.li3: The breath of Yahweh burns in it like a stream of sulfur.
